abstract: In their first joint development project, the two automakers aim to save money as they work to meet government fuel-efficiency standards.
snippet: In their first joint development project, the two automakers aim to save money as they work to meet government fuel-efficiency standards.
lead_paragraph: DEARBORN, Mich. — Ford Motor Company and Toyota Motor said on Monday that they would jointly develop a gas-electric hybrid fuel system for pickup trucks and sport utility vehicles aimed at keeping larger models affordable as the automakers work to meet stricter fuel-economy standards.

headline.main: Ford and Toyota to Work Together on Hybrid System for Trucks
headline.print_headline: Ford and Toyota to Work Together on Hybrid System for Trucks

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Sports Utility Vehicles and Light Trucks
